timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
Multimap<String, String> multimap = HashMultimap.create();
if (map != null) multimap.putAll(map);
return multimap;
return (map != null) ? HashMultimap.create(map) : HashMultimap.create();
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.bodyHTML:
Suggested change
String range =
(offset != null)
? ("bytes=" + offset + "-" + (length != null ? offset + length - 1 : ""))
: null;
String range = null;
if(offset != null) {
range = "bytes=" + offset + "-";
if(length != null) {
range = range + (offset + length - 1);
}
}

Couple of more lines, but I think this is more readable.
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

timeline.body: Earlier, when the condition was false (`bypassGovernanceMode() / args.versionId() != null`), an empty multimap was being passed. Now null is being passed. Is this fine?
timeline.bodyText: Earlier, when the condition was false (bypassGovernanceMode() / args.versionId() != null), an empty multimap was being passed. Now null is being passed. Is this fine?
timeline.bodyHTML: Earlier, when the condition was false (bypassGovernanceMode() / args.versionId() != null), an empty multimap was being passed. Now null is being passed. Is this fine?
timeline.author: anjalshireesh

replies.bodyText: No problem. execute() takes care null values properly.
replies.author: balamurugana
